result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew John McDonald

records.addlTxt:
2:10 PM Defendant Matthew John McDonald appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Matthew John McDonald.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Status from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Defendant still in treatment. No objection from the State. If defendant is out of treatment-he must appear in person. Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:18 AM Defendant Matthew John McDonald appeared by video.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Matthew John McDonald. Court calls case and appearances. Court questions the defendant re: his right to appear in person. Court finds the defendant waives his right to appear in person. Waived formal reading. Not guilty plea is entered. Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:10 pm.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 02:10 pm.

Court questions the defendant. Attorney Thomas-Schmidt speaks to the court. Court continues questioning the defendant.  Court finds the defendant freely and knowingly waives his right to a preliminary hearing. No argument. Court finds probable cause.

11:04 AM Defendant Matthew John McDonald in court.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Matthew John McDonald. Court calls case and appearances. Atty Thomas-Schmidt states it will be a waiver.
Arraignment scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:07 AM Defendant, Matthew John McDonald appeared with Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Set for preliminary hearing. Waived time limits. Bond to continue.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

w/ $1,000.00 Signature Bond

Court calls case and appearances. Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washburn County Jail. Sheila Yonk appears for the State. Atty Stephanie-Thomas Schmidt appears for the Public Defenders Office.  Court speaks re: probable cause. Court does find probable cause. Court questions the defendant.

Current Address:
4602 Onieda St.
Duluth, MN 
#218-606-2270
No contacts w/ Washburn County. Unemployed. No currently supervised. Defendant does qualify.

State makes bond argument-low cash bail requested. Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes argument. Court sets $100 cash bond. Will review in 1-week, if defendant has not posed. 

Initial Appearance 3/28 @ 10:00
